text: Time is what we want most, but what we use worst.
author: William Penn

text: The key is in not spending time, but in investing it.
author: Stephen R. Covey

text: Lost time is never found again.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
author: Sam Levenson

text: You may delay, but time will not.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Memento mori. Remember you will die.
author: Stoic Philosophy

text: The future depends on what you do today.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: An inch of time is an inch of gold, but you can't buy that inch of time with an inch of gold.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: The two most powerful warriors are patience and time.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: Time is a created thing. To say 'I don't have time,' is like saying, 'I don't want to.'
author: Lao Tzu

text: Your time is limited, so don’t waste it living someone else’s life.
author: Steve Jobs

text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Time flies over us, but leaves its shadow behind.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

text: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.
author: Charles Darwin

text: The way we spend our time defines who we are.
author: Jonathan Estrin

text: Time is the most valuable thing a man can spend.
author: Theophrastus

text: Productivity is never an accident. It is always the result of a commitment to excellence, intelligent planning, and focused effort.
author: Paul J. Meyer

text: Focus on being productive instead of busy.
author: Tim Ferriss

text: The shorter way to do many things is to do only one thing at a time.
author: Mozart

text: Until we can manage time, we can manage nothing else.
author: Peter Drucker

text: The bad news is time flies. The good news is you’re the pilot.
author: Michael Altshuler

text: Ordinary people think merely of spending time, great people think of using it.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

text: Time is the wisest counselor of all.
author: Pericles

text: If you want to make good use of your time, you’ve got to know what’s most important and then give it all you’ve got.
author: Lee Iacocca

text: We must use time as a tool, not as a couch.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: Time is a storm in which we are all lost.
author: William Carlos Williams

text: Let him who would enjoy a good future waste none of his present.
author: Roger Babson

text: Defer no time, delays have dangerous ends.
author: William Shakespeare

text: This is the key to time management - to see the value of every moment.
author: Menachem Mendel Schneerson

text: Time takes it all, whether you want it to or not.
author: Stephen King

text: What then is time? If no one asks me, I know what it is. If I wish to explain it to him who asks, I do not know.
author: Augustine of Hippo

text: Time is the school in which we learn, time is the fire in which we burn.
author: Delmore Schwartz

text: Either you run the day, or the day runs you.
author: Jim Rohn

text: The common man is not concerned about the passage of time, the man of talent is driven by it.
author: Shoppenhauer

text: Suspect each moment, for it is a thief, tiptoeing away with more than it brings.
author: John Updike

text: To choose time is to save time.
author: Francis Bacon

text: Regret for wasted time is more wasted time.
author: Mason Cooley

text: Time management is life management.
author: Robin Sharma

text: The proper function of man is to live, not to exist. I shall not waste my days in trying to prolong them. I shall use my time.
author: Jack London

text: Determine never to be idle. No person will have occasion to complain of the want of time who never loses any. It is wonderful how much may be done if we are always doing.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Know the true value of time; snatch, seize, and enjoy every moment of it. No idleness, no laziness, no procrastination: never put off till tomorrow what you can do today.
author: Philip Stanhope, 4th Earl of Chesterfield

text: You will never find time for anything. If you want time, you must make it.
author: Charles Buxton

text: Time is long to a man who knows how to use it.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: There’s never enough time to do all the nothing you want.
author: Bill Watterson

text: The great dividing line between success and failure can be expressed in five words: 'I did not have time.'
author: Franklin Field

text: Nothing is a waste of time if you use the experience wisely.
author: Auguste Rodin

text: He who knows most, knows how troublesome it is to know nothing.
author: Turkish Proverb

text: Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow has not yet come. We have only today. Let us begin.
author: Mother Teresa

text: It is not that we have a short time to live, but that we waste a lot of it.
author: Seneca

text: Let not your life be wholly without acting. Take some part in the play of existence.
author: Baltasar Gracián
